result.execSummary:
The defendant Monteri Leshaun Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become imediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.
Follow the rules and conditions of probation as set by agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Monteri Leshaun Jones

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 10 DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; credit for 2 days time served. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 12 MONTHS with the following conditions:
- Follow the rules and conditions of probation as set by agent.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant.

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Defendant Monteri Leshaun Jones in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report date May 18, 2015 received and filed. tk

Defendant Monteri Leshaun Jones in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
State provides certified copy of judgment of conviction for case 10CM3645, received and filed.
Defense counsel received discovery and offer.  Court orders case for adjourned Plea and Sentencing on 5-19-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated April 6, 2015, received and filed.

Defendant Monteri Leshaun Jones in court with attorney Mark Dluzak for Anne A. Devitt.  Hanna Kolberg for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17 due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Arraignment scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Progarm Report dated 3/23/15.
css
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.

Defendant Monteri Leshaun Jones in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Monteri Leshaun Jones in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch 3.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
